fields.description:
*Setup*

We create a windows instance on Eucalyptus 3.2.2 cloud. The version of Windows image is server 2008R2 x86_64.

We have the windows integration tool also installed and the Eucalyptus windows service is also configured to start during boot.

Now, after the instance is running, we change the "computer name" (default is set to the instance ID) from inside the instance.

Changing the "computer name" , requires a reboot, we reboot the instance and login again, we find that the "computer name" is again set to the instance-ID.

This is not inline with the behaviour seen with the windows instances on AWS EC2, following AMI on EC2 was tested to confirm the behaviour

{code}
Windows_Server-2008-R2_SP1-English-64Bit-Base-2013.04.14 (ami-8854c3b8)
Description:	Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 Datacenter 64-bit Locale English Base AMI provided by Amazon
Status:	available
Platform:	Windows
Image size:	30 GB
Visibility:	Public
Owner:	amazon (801119661308)
{code}

If we disable the Eucalyptus windows service, the "computer name" does not get set to the "instance ID" on reboot.

Please let us know if its alright to have the Eucalyptus windows service disabled? Does it affect in any ways with the operations?

If Eucalyptus windows service is required or if it provides a key functionality, we should make sure our behaviour is inline with AWS EC2.
fields.summary: Windows Integration Tool:  Changing the "computer name" does not work on Windows Instances

comments.body:
_*Feedback from [~dshekhawat]*_

Please see the following link to EC2Config a service provided by AWS for Windows AMIs

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/WindowsGuide/UsingConfig_WinAMI.html

It provides a parameter in its configuration (config.xml) Ec2SetComputerName , following is the documentation around it:

"Ec2SetComputerName—Sets the hostname of the instance to a unique name based on the IP address of the instance and reboots the instance. To set your own hostname, or prevent your existing hostname from being modified, you must disable this setting."

_*Additional investigation done by [~dshekhawat]*_

Debugging this issue some more I found the following (hope this is useful for future readers):

On the NC, where the instance runs, there is a file /usr/share/eucalyptus/floppy , the NC copies this file to the instance work directory, during the instance creation, this file when loopback mounted, has a file configuration.xml that looks like following, originally

{code}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<Configuration xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" version="0.1" xmlns="http://eucalyptus.com">
  <Hostname>MAGICEUCALYPTUSHOSTNAMEPLACEHOLDER</Hostname>
  <LocalAccount>
	<Username>Administrator</Username>
	<Password>MAGICEUCALYPTUSPASSWORDPLACEHOLDER</Password>
  </LocalAccount>
  <ActiveDirectory xsi:nil="true" />
</Configuration>
{code}

Now the NC reads this file and replaces "MAGICEUCALYPTUSHOSTNAMEPLACEHOLDER" and "MAGICEUCALYPTUSPASSWORDPLACEHOLDER" with the correct values during instance creation, relevant code is here 

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/testing/storage/storage-windows.c#L434-L446

After the changes are done, the modified file is presented to the instance inside A:\\ (floppy drive), the Eucalyptus windows service reads this file and modifies "computer name" and "password" accordingly.

Now if we change the "computer name" from inside the instance, the instance needs to be rebooted, when it comes up, the Eucalyptus windows service again reads the configuration.xml file in A:\\ and again applies the same changes, that is setting the "computer name" to the instance ID (as the configuration.xml still has the instance ID as the computer name in it).

Looks like the logic in EucaServiceLibrary.cs replaces the name on reboot:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/windows-integration/blob/master/EucaServiceLibrary/EucaServiceLibrary.cs#L227-L270

Seems like this is the driver for updating https://github.com/eucalyptus/windows-integration/blob/master/EucaServiceLibrary/configuration.xml.
The workaround does not work if the instance is stopped and then started (EBS backed)
Harold/Deependra are working on this and will have a pull request coming.  They could use some assistance on the testing side once the pull request is ready.

Pull request for this fix found here:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/windows-integration/pull/5

Thanks to [~dshekhawat] for his help with this.
We need to determine the release date of the next version of the Windows integration tool

Windows version: Windows 2008 R2 Enterprise x86_64
Eucalyptus version: 3.3.0 git commit ID 3485d8ce48e63e9818d20c0d92abc4e344dbda70
Type of instance: EBS
Eucalyptus Windows Integration Tool: Latest with the fix in this bug , available here http://jeevanullas.in/tmp/EucalyptusWindowsIntegration.msi

a) Changed the computer name on the running instance and rebooted. The changed computer name persisted after the reboot. PASS

b) After (a) stopped the instance and then started it again, verified the computer name persisted across stop/start. PASS

Hope this helps the QA process.
Closing based on test results from [~dshekhawat]
